metadata.titleEn: High precision MC-ICP-MS data set for Mo isotope analysis of igneous rocks with low Mo content
metadata.description: The data in this paper include the Mo content and isotopic ratio analysis data of different types of igneous rock standard samples (basalt bir-1a, diabase w-2a, dunite dts-2b, wpr-1 and peridotite gpt-3) and low Mo content leucogranite. The Leucogranites are from saga, Cuona and zhengga areas in southern Tibet; Mo isotope analysis data were determined by multi collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (MC – ICP – MS), and the standard sample and leucogranite data were obtained to verify the accuracy and accuracy of the established analysis method for low Mo content samples, so as to achieve high-precision Mo isotope analysis for more low content samples.
metadata.instructions: All data are stored in Excel file: the file name is ig.std.xls, which represents the Mo content and isotope ratio analysis data of igneous rocks and standard samples

authorList.unitEn: Guangzhou Institute of Geochemistry, Chinese Academy of Sciences

literatureList.titleEn: High-precision low Mo content igneous rock sample Mo isotope MC-ICP-MS analysis dataset

Concept Completion.Question: What data collection methods are used for obtaining Mo isotope analysis in low Mo content igneous rock samples?

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used for analyzing Mo isotope ratios in low Mo content igneous rock samples?
Example.Answer: An example of a data collection method used for analyzing Mo isotope ratios in low Mo content igneous rock samples involves using multi-collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (MC-ICP-MS) to determine the Mo content and isotope ratios. This method is applied to various igneous rock standards, including basalt BIR-1a, diabase W-2a, peridotite DTS-2b, WPR-1, and dunite GPt-3, as well as low Mo content leucogranites collected from regions in southern Tibet such as Saga, Cuona, and Zhengga.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the specific characteristics of Mo isotope data when collected from low Mo content igneous rock samples using MC-ICP-MS?
Feature Specification.Answer: precise measurements, accurate measurements, Mo content, isotopic ratios

Quantification.Question: How many different types of igneous rock samples are analyzed for Mo isotopic composition using MC-ICP-MS in a dataset related to this field?

Definition.Question: What does 'MC-ICP-MS' mean in the context of analyzing Mo isotopes in igneous rock samples?
Definition.Answer: MC-ICP-MS stands for Multi-Collector Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry, a technique used to measure Mo isotopes in igneous rock samples with high precision and accuracy. It is instrumental in verifying the analytical method's precision for low Mo content samples.

Goal Orientation.Question: What are the objectives behind developing a data collection method for Mo isotope analysis in low Mo content igneous rock samples using MC-ICP-MS?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The objective is to establish and validate a high-precision method for analyzing Mo isotopes in low Mo content samples, such as light-colored granites, using MC-ICP-MS. This aims to ensure accuracy and precision in Mo isotope analysis across a broader range of low-content samples, enhancing the understanding of igneous rock formation and geochemical processes.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures can be followed to ensure high precision and accuracy in Mo isotope analysis of low Mo content igneous rock samples using MC–ICP–MS?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: To achieve high precision and accuracy in Mo isotope analysis of low Mo content igneous rock samples using MC–ICP–MS, it involves using different types of igneous rock standards such as basalt BIR-1a, diabase W-2a, peridotite DTS-2b, WPR-1, and GPt-3, as well as low Mo content leucogranite samples from regions in southern Tibet. The Mo isotope data is obtained through multi-collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry, and the data from the standards and leucogranite is used to verify the precision and accuracy of the analytical method established for low Mo content samples.
